fast3d.math

Class CameraMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.math.CameraMode

  • public class CameraMode
extends java.lang.Object
    defining how a shader should render things on a cameras screen
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean inscreen
      for all vertices shaded outside the screen-bounds, the result will be null.
      boolean notincam
      not in camera
      if turned true, only vertices outside of the camera are shaded -otherwise the shading result is null
      if turned false: vertices between camera-position and screen are shaded
      default / normal is false
      notincam is disabled (not considered) for viewmode=ORTHOGONAL
      boolean oriented
      if turned true, for all vertices behind the cameras position the shading result will be null.
      Viewmode viewmode
      the cameras viewmode
      for GET-access please use getViewmode()
      boolean wireframe
      determines whether to fill polygons (false) or just draw the sides (true), default / normal is false

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CameraMode(Viewmode vm, boolean m_nIC, boolean m_o, boolean m_iS, boolean wf)
      constructs a new camera mode with the given parameters

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CameraMode clone() 
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      compares this with the parameter and returns false if the parameter is not of the same type
      Viewmode getViewmode()
      should be used instead of direct access to the field because enums can be null and the viewmode should have a valid value -not null-
      if the viewmode field contains null it will be set to Viewmode.PERSPECTIVE as requested by the Viewmode doc and then the value is returned
      static CameraMode normalOrthogonalMode() 
      static CameraMode normalPerspectiveMode() 
      java.lang.String toString()

    • Field Detail

      • viewmode

        public Viewmode viewmode
        the cameras viewmode
        for GET-access please use getViewmode()

      • wireframe

        public boolean wireframe
        determines whether to fill polygons (false) or just draw the sides (true), default / normal is false

      • oriented

        public boolean oriented
        if turned true, for all vertices behind the cameras position the shading result will be null.
        if turned false, the camera's screen will also mirror everything behind the camera
        default / normal is true

      • notincam

        public boolean notincam
        not in camera
        if turned true, only vertices outside of the camera are shaded -otherwise the shading result is null
        if turned false: vertices between camera-position and screen are shaded
        default / normal is false
        notincam is disabled (not considered) for viewmode=ORTHOGONAL

      • inscreen

        public boolean inscreen
        for all vertices shaded outside the screen-bounds, the result will be null.
        if turned true, some triangles partly out-of-screen will not be drawn entirely
        if turned false, all out-of-clip drawing actions will be done which costs time
        default / normal is false

    • Constructor Detail

      • CameraMode

        public CameraMode(Viewmode vm,
                  boolean m_nIC,
                  boolean m_o,
                  boolean m_iS,
                  boolean wf)
        constructs a new camera mode with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        vm - the viewmode field value
        m_nIC - the notincam field value
        m_o - the oriented field value
        m_iS - the inscreen field value
        wf - the wireframe field value

    • Method Detail

      • getViewmode

        public Viewmode getViewmode()
        should be used instead of direct access to the field because enums can be null and the viewmode should have a valid value -not null-
        if the viewmode field contains null it will be set to Viewmode.PERSPECTIVE as requested by the Viewmode doc and then the value is returned
        Returns:
        the valid viewmode field value

      • normalPerspectiveMode

        public static CameraMode normalPerspectiveMode()
        Returns:
        a camera mode as the eyes of an human have in the real world

      • normalOrthogonalMode

        public static CameraMode normalOrthogonalMode()
        Returns:
        a camera mode useful as a construction painting (blueprint-view)
